definition: classifier for a ream of paper
to order/to command/an order/warrant/writ/to cause/to make sth happen/virtuous/honorific title/season/government position (old)
to respect/to admire/to venerate/by the emperor himself

sentences.english: The remarkable achievements of Chinese economy are admirable.
sentences.chinese: 中國經濟發展成績斐然，令人欽佩。

sentences.english: I think he conducted himself admirably, considering the difficult circumstances.
sentences.chinese: 考慮到那種困難環境，我認爲他表現得令人欽佩。
貝頓是個令人欽佩的人物。

sentences.english: Stoere said China has made admirable achievements in its reform and opening-up endeavor.
sentences.chinese: 斯特勒說，中國改革開放取得巨大成就，令人欽佩。

sentences.english: That's admirable, and exactly my own approach to life.
sentences.chinese: 那是令人欽佩的，能準確地找到自己的生活。

sentences.english: Now the communitarian would say there is something admirable in that.
sentences.chinese: 現在共同體主義者會說，其中有令人欽佩之處。

sentences.english: But Mrs Clinton was also helped by her extraordinary indomitability in the face of adversity.
sentences.chinese: 不過希拉里在困難面前的不屈不撓的精神令人欽佩。

sentences.english: Erudition is admirable, but it seldom leads to masterpieces.
sentences.chinese: 博學令人欽佩，但它很少能導致傑作的產生。

sentences.english: The results of this investment are sometimes hubristic , but often impressive.
sentences.chinese: 這種做法雖然有些狂妄自大，卻也令人欽佩。

sentences.english: This is an admirable goal, and one I wholeheartedly endorse.
sentences.chinese: 這是一個令人欽佩的目標，我非常贊同。

sentences.english: The Nishi Building also displays admirable environmental initiative.
sentences.chinese: 西大樓也表現出令人欽佩的環保倡議。
